base.description: Base layer (z-index: 0). DEFAULT for all standard content. Use for: page content, cards, sections, anything in normal document flow. Establishes baseline - everything else stacks above this. Never use negative z-index unless absolutely necessary.

app.description: Application layer (z-index: 100). Use for: app-level UI chrome, sidebars, persistent navigation. First elevated layer above base content. Common in: app shells, navigation drawers, persistent toolbars.

dropdown.description: Dropdown layer (z-index: 150). Use for: dropdown menus, select options, autocomplete lists, combobox panels. Above app chrome but below sticky headers. Common in: Select menu, Dropdown, Autocomplete, Menu, Popover (when not in modal).

sticky.description: Sticky layer (z-index: 200). Use for: sticky headers, fixed navigation, persistent UI elements, scroll-aware banners. Stays visible during scroll but below overlay content. Common in: Sticky header, fixed sidebar, persistent action bars, scroll-to-top buttons.

overlay.description: Overlay layer (z-index: 300). Use for: modal backdrops, drawer overlays, lightbox backgrounds, focus-trap containers. Dims/blocks underlying content. Separate from modal content to allow proper stacking. Common in: Modal backdrop, Drawer backdrop, lightbox overlay.

modal.description: Modal layer (z-index: 400). Use for: modal dialogs, side drawers, full-screen overlays, dialog content. Primary overlay content layer - above backdrop but below popovers. Common in: Modal content, Drawer content, Dialog, Sheet, full-screen menus.

popover.description: Popover layer (z-index: 500). Use for: popovers triggered from within modals, nested floating elements, color pickers, date pickers in modals. Above modal content but below tooltips. Common in: DatePicker in modal, ColorPicker in modal, nested menus.

tooltip.description: Tooltip layer (z-index: 600). Use for: tooltips, toasts, notifications, snackbars. Near top of standard layers. Common in: Tooltip, Toast, Snackbar, notification badges, loading indicators.

max.description: Maximum layer (z-index: 9999). HIGHEST layer - use sparingly. Use for: critical system overlays, loading states that must block all interaction, debug overlays. Reserved for truly exceptional cases where nothing else should appear on top.
